title: Drawing, 1735–36
medium: Pen and black and gray ink, brush and gray wash, gouache over graphite, on three joined sheets of white laid paper, incised for transfer to engraving plate
markings: Watermarks, at left: MGIS; at right: bunch of grapes (RPW '60)
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink, verso: loup de la Chambre a coucher de M. le Prince de Rohan / D.4
provenance: From the Léchener Collection (according to Decloux: not in Lugt); from the Collection of Léon Decloux (acquired before 1906)
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: The elevation shows the bed alcove, seen from the side left, and set in beside one (of a pair) Corinthian columns. The rest of the interior shows a fireplace, center, and a double paneled door at the right. The wooden paneling is richly carved and painted, as indicated for the over-doors and the panel at left of the fireplace.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, 1735–36.
1735–36. Pen and black and gray ink, brush and gray wash, gouache over graphite, on three joined sheets of white laid paper, incised for transfer to engraving plate. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-5.
